direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve calculations based on the size of unknownAttributes and handle padding to ensure the length is a multiple of 4 bytes.
Both methods process attribute data and ensure that the length of the data is handled correctly, with a focus on ensuring the length is a multiple of 4 bytes.
The equals method relies on getDataLength to compare attribute lengths, indicating a dependency that can be tested together.
Both methods involve operations related to the size of the unknownAttributes list, although getAttributeCount is simpler and directly returns the size.
